item.title: Xbox Slayings
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: I must have been really busy in August 2004 that I missed this tangentially gaming-related crime: Four dudes, seeking to recover the one dude’s Xbox, beat six people to death with baseball bats. From the Wired article: “Investigators said they … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded: I must have been really busy in August 2004 that I missed this tangentially gaming-related crime: Four dudes, seeking to recover the one dude’s Xbox, beat six people to death with baseball bats. From the Wired article: “Investigators said they (the victims) had been terrorized for several days over the Xbox, which Victorino (the one dude) had left at another Deltona (Flordia) house where he had been squatting. The game system was taken by Belanger (a victim) when she cleared Victorino’s things out of her grandparents’ winter house.” Few lessons for us all here: someone starts terrorizing you over property (i.e. inanimate objects), give it back … at least pitch it out on the sidewalk … and, not to impune the victims here, but socializing with squatters is a bad idea. For one, they’re prone to overstaying their welcome at your house.

item.title: Starforce (not another star MMOG)
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: When will those crazy DRM kids learn? People really don’t want auto-installing programs hidden inside their games even if the DRM crap is free. Boycott Starforce has information about Starforce, not another star MMOG btw, this is DRM crap (DRM … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded: When will those crazy DRM kids learn? People really don’t want auto-installing programs hidden inside their games even if the DRM crap is free. Boycott Starforce has information about Starforce, not another star MMOG btw, this is DRM crap (DRM = digital rights management, but you can just call it crap if you want). It’s free though. FREE!! And lookit here, I see that Boing Boing has run afoul of the Starforce kids by breaking APPROXIMATELY 11 imaginary international laws.

item.title: Acclaim’s Bankruptcy Sale
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: If you’re looking to break into the gaming industry, check out the titles and current bids for Acclaim Entertainment’s bankruptcy auction. Someone is willing to pay $5,000 for the rights to “Mary Kate & Ashley Get A Clue.” God. That … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded: If you’re looking to break into the gaming industry, check out the titles and current bids for Acclaim Entertainment’s bankruptcy auction. Someone is willing to pay $5,000 for the rights to “Mary Kate & Ashley Get A Clue.” God. That raises a ton of questions: Who is that guy? Why man, WHY? Who greenlighted that shit? Where is he (she) now? Was it suicide? …

item.title: Is Copyright Dying?
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description: Gamasutra’s interesting discussion on the future of copyrights: Designer’s Notebook – “The End Of Copyright”. As the definition of Fair Use expands, new marketing and delivery models are needed to fund the arts. And games. (Ok, games are art too. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded: Gamasutra’s interesting discussion on the future of copyrights: Designer’s Notebook – “The End Of Copyright”. As the definition of Fair Use expands, new marketing and delivery models are needed to fund the arts. And games. (Ok, games are art too. I was trying to stir the pot a little.)
